Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek Papyrus
Description: These fragments of papyrus, which come from Oxyrhynchus and which date from the 2nd century of our time, carry extracts of the comedy "Ploutoi" of Cratinus (5th century BC). This writer originally from Athens was a big name of ancient comedy. None of his works have been passed on via medieval manuscripts. Several fragments of the same manuscript are preserved in the Museum of Florence.
